title: 2001년 Nash 사건
summary: 미국 Michigan, MI 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Nash. 판결일: 2001-02-27. 법원: Michigan Court of Appeals.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: People v. Nash
**판결일**: 2001-02-27
**법원**: Michigan Court of Appeals
**관할**: Michigan, MI

**판사**: Gribbs, P.J., and Hoekstra and Markey

## 변호인

Jennifer M. Granholm, Attorney General, Thomas L. Casey, Solicitor General, John D. O’Hair, Prosecuting Attorney, Timothy A. Baughman, Chief of Research, Training, and Appeals, and Ana I. Quiroz, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for the people., Robert M. Morgan, for the defendant.

## 인용

- 625 N.W.2d 87
- 244 Mich. App. 93

## 판결문 요약


625 N.W.2d 87 (2000)
244 Mich. App. 93
PEOPLE of the State of Michigan, Plaintiff-Appellee,
v.
Donald Edward NASH, Defendant-Appellant.
Docket No. 208799.
Court of Appeals of Michigan.
Submitted April 11, 2000, at Detroit.
Decided December 26, 2000, at 9:15 a.m.
Released for publication February 27, 2001.
*89 Jennifer M. Granholm, Attorney General, Thomas L. Casey, Solicitor General, John D. O'Hair, Prosecuting Attorney, Timothy A. Baughman, Chief of Research, Training, and Appeals, and Ana I. Quiroz, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, for the people.
Robert M. Morgan, Detroit, for the defendant.
Before GRIBBS, P.J., and HOEKSTRA and MARKEY, JJ.
*88 PER CURIAM.
Defendant appeals as of right from his jury trial convictions of first-degree murder, M.C.L. § 750.316; MSA 28.548, and possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, M.C.L. § 750.227b; MSA 28.424(2). Defendant was sentenced to life imprisonment for the first-degree murder conviction and two years' imprisonment for the felony-firearm conviction, the sentences to run consecutively. We reverse.
Defendant raises numerous issues on appeal, one of which we find requires us to reverse his convictions, that issue being that defendant was denied due process and a fair trial when the prosecution's key witness made reference to having taken a polygraph examination.


*90 I
The victim in this case was shot to death inside a dry-cleaning establishment where she worked. The murder went unsolved for ten years. Relatives of...
